summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel discussing forensic review of digital evidence related to the Epstein case. The emails coordinate access to the CAIR system, reference specific evidence items from a New York apartment, and arrange for a hard drive drop-off.

persons.name: M, I.
persons.context: FBI Special Agent from New York Field Office working on Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking cases, involved in coordinating forensic review of evidence.

events.title: Forensic evidence coordination
events.description: FBI Special Agent M, I. requests location of three specific items in the CAIR system and asks for CAIR access to be granted to other individuals to assist in the review.

events.title: Evidence follow-up
events.description: An FBI agent reports finding all but one of the requested evidence items and plans to visit the CART coordinator the next day to drop off a hard drive.

events.title: Forensic image clarification
events.description: A Senior Forensic Examiner clarifies that a particular image was from a gaming computer from a New York apartment and references a specific forensic report number.

keyFacts: The document references forensic evidence from a gaming computer located in a New York apartment.
Specific evidence items are identified by codes: NYC 024394, NYC 024390, NYC 024334, and NY-3027571.
FBI personnel are coordinating access to the CAIR (Child Abduction and Rapid Deployment) system for evidence review.
The emails involve FBI Special Agents and a Senior Forensic Examiner working on child exploitation/human trafficking cases.
The document is subject to a protective order restricting certain paragraphs.
